records.location_details: An officer twisted an ankle in a small hole while walking on the street in Mytilini, Lesvos, Greece.
records.context_note: An officer sustained a minor ankle injury due to a small hole on the street in Mytilini, Lesvos. The officer received medical attention and was prescribed crutches but remained operationally available.
records.evidence_quote: Walking on the street in Mytilini, on 18.06.2020 afternoon, Text Removed - Justification 2 twisted the ankle in a small hole.

records.location_details: Near Chios, Greece, involving a TCG (Turkish Coast Guard) patrol boat and a Greek fishing vessel. The incident occurred in the borderline of GTW and TTW.
records.context_note: A TCG patrol boat harassed a Greek fishing vessel and a Frontex asset near Chios, Greece, in disputed waters. The TCG boat engaged in aggressive driving and did not respond to communication attempts. The incident lasted approximately two hours before the TCG boat returned to the Turkish coast. Measures included informing relevant parties and emphasizing adherence to operational plans and safety protocols.
records.evidence_quote: incident between a TCG patrol boat and Text Removed - Justification 6. ... driving around of a Greek fishing vessel (AGIA PARASKEVI). The fishing vessel was just in the borderline of GTW and TTW.

records.location_details: On board a vessel deployed to Lesvos, Greece.
records.uncertainty_note: Specific location on Lesvos or exact vessel type/location is redacted.
records.context_note: An officer sustained a tibia fissure (leg injury) after falling during maintenance activity on board a vessel deployed to Lesvos, Greece. The officer received medical treatment and was advised to rest.
records.evidence_quote: During maintenance activity of the vessel the officer fell down and injured his leg. ... the result of X-Ray was Tibia fissure.

records.location_details: RIC Vial, Chios, Greece.
records.uncertainty_note: The coordinates are for Chios, but the text specifies RIC Vial.
records.context_note: Riots and fires broke out at RIC Vial in Chios, Greece, following the death of a 49-year-old woman. Offices, canteen, cars, tents, and containers were damaged. Frontex containers sustained minor damages.
records.evidence_quote: During the night fires broke out in the offices of the Asylum Service, as well as in the canteen of RIC VIAL. Two cars were also set on fire, while the refugees were engaged in a stone fight with HP.

records.location_details: Aegean Sea, during Rapid Border Intervention Aegean 2020.
records.uncertainty_note: Specific location is redacted, but context points to Aegean Sea.
records.context_note: A Frontex asset (Text Removed - Justification 6) was intercepted by two Turkish Air Force F-16s in the Aegean Sea during a patrol. The asset was challenged multiple times by Turkish radars.
records.evidence_quote: Text Removed - Justification 6 was intercepted at 12:36Z by -02- Turkish Airforce F-16.

records.location_details: Vial camp, Chios, Greece.
records.uncertainty_note: The coordinates are for Chios, but the text specifies Vial camp.
records.context_note: Two Frontex personnel were involved in an incident with locals near Vial camp in Chios, Greece. Their rental car was damaged by a crowd during demonstrations. No physical injuries were reported for the officers.
records.evidence_quote: crowd intercepted their vehicle and started damaging the rental car (at least both mirrors are broken).

records.location_details: Mytilini, Lesvos, Greece, including the port area, city center, Karava area, and Mantamados area.
records.uncertainty_note: Specific coordinates are redacted, but multiple locations on Lesvos are mentioned.
records.context_note: Violent protests and demonstrations occurred in Mytilini, Lesvos, including the port area, city center, Karava, and Mantamados. Frontex personnel encountered blocked roads and had their vehicle damaged by demonstrators. No injuries to Frontex staff were reported.
records.evidence_quote: Riot in Lesvos - FRONTEX patrol blocked by the demonstrators. ... Demonstrators were shouting and one of the demonstrators was kicking the right and the front of the Text Removed - Justification 6 broke a mirror of the Text Removed - Justification 6.

records.location_details: Alexandroupolis, Nomós Évrou, Greece, during patrol activity.
records.context_note: A crew member injured their right knee after sliding off stairs while attempting to take a towing rubber boat during patrol activity in Alexandroupolis, Greece. Medical examination suggested stretched ligaments.
records.evidence_quote: one of the crew members, while attempting to take a towing rubber boat, slid off the stairs and injured his right leg knee.

records.location_details: Evros, Greece.
records.uncertainty_note: Specific location within Evros is redacted.
records.context_note: Frontex TMs and Hellenic Police officers heard gunshots in the Evros region of Greece. The shots were distant, and no visual contact with shooters was made. No injuries were reported.
records.evidence_quote: FX TM's Text Removed - Justification 2,3 informed about hearable gunshots Text Removed - Justification 5. ... Nobody was injured

records.location_details: Alexandroupoli Airport, Evros, Greece (initial detection of loss), Sofia Airport, Bulgaria (where weapon was found).
records.where_clear: Alexandroupoli Airport, Greece (lost), Sofia Airport, Bulgaria (found)
records.geocodable_query: Alexandroupoli Airport, Greece; Sofia Airport, Bulgaria
records.context_note: A gun belonging to a Frontex TM was reported missing during weapon handover at Alexandroupoli Airport, Greece, after a flight from Sofia. An investigation revealed the weapon had fallen off the luggage belt at Sofia Airport, Bulgaria, and was later recovered.
records.evidence_quote: during handing over the weapons from airport staff to FX TMs, one gun Text Removed Justification 2 was missed. ... the weapon was found at Sofia Airport.

records.location_details: Railway line from Alexandroupolis to Ormenio, Evros, Greece.
records.where_clear: Railway line between Alexandroupolis and Ormenio, Evros, Greece
records.geocodable_query: Railway line Alexandroupolis to Ormenio, Evros, Greece
records.uncertainty_note: Specific point on the railway line is not given.
records.context_note: A 25-year-old male migrant was hit and killed by a train on the railway line between Alexandroupolis and Ormenio, Evros, Greece. It is believed he was sleeping on the tracks. No criminal activity was recognized.
records.evidence_quote: one (01) migrant (male) was hit and killed by train running from Alexandroupolis to Ormenio.

records.location_details: Evros, Greece, specifically near Marasia (border village north of Kastanies).
records.uncertainty_note: Specific coordinates are redacted, but a village name is provided.
records.context_note: Frontex teams patrolling in Evros, Greece, heard multiple gunfire shots, some reported to be from a Turkish patrol in the Marasia border area. The origin of some shots could not be localized due to wind. No injuries were reported.
records.evidence_quote: reported that they heard a few possible gunfire shots, coming from Marasia (border village to the north of Kastanies).

records.location_details: Evros, Greece, after crossing the Evros river.
records.uncertainty_note: Specific location within Evros is redacted.
records.context_note: Hellenic Police officers found a dead male migrant and two other migrants (his children) in Evros, Greece. The migrants had illegally crossed the Evros river. The autopsy indicated the father died of a heart attack, consistent with his children's statements about his heart problems.
records.evidence_quote: HP Officers Text Removed - Justification 3 found 2 migrants (male and female) and a dead body (male). Those 2 migrants stated that the dead person is their father - SYR national and they had entered the Greek territory illegally from Evros river a few hours ago.

records.location_details: Evros river, close to the Greek bank, Evros, Greece.
records.where_clear: Evros river, Greek bank, Evros, Greece
records.geocodable_query: Evros river, Greek bank, Evros, Greece
records.uncertainty_note: Specific location on the river bank is redacted.
records.context_note: A dead male body, likely a migrant, was found in the Evros river near the Greek bank. The autopsy showed no criminal activity as the cause of death.
records.evidence_quote: one (1) male dead body (about thirty years old) has been found in the river of Evros, close to the Greek bank

records.location_details: Evros, Greece, near Alexandroupolis.
records.uncertainty_note: Specific location within Evros is redacted.
records.context_note: A dead male body was found in the Evros area of Greece. No travel documents were found. The autopsy showed no criminal activity as the cause of death.
records.evidence_quote: a dead body (male) has been found in the area. No travel documents have been found.

records.location_details: Evros, Greece, with shots heard from the Turkish side.
records.where_clear: Evros, Greece (border area, shots from Turkish side)
records.uncertainty_note: Specific location within Evros is redacted, and the origin of shots is from the Turkish side.
records.context_note: Frontex personnel in Evros, Greece, heard four gunshots coming from the Turkish side of the border. No Turkish forces or other persons were observed, and the exact origin of the shots was unclear. No injuries were reported.
records.evidence_quote: 4 (four) shots heard on 12.05.2020 at 23:30 from the Turkish side.

records.location_details: Alexandroupoli hospital, Evros, Greece.
records.context_note: A Frontex TM deployed in Evros, Greece, was hospitalized in Alexandroupoli with severe bellyache, diagnosed as possible appendicitis and treated as a potential COVID-19 case due to fever. The officer was expected to recover and resume duties by late May/early June.
records.evidence_quote: Text Removed - Justification 2 deployed under RBI 2020 Evros who was transported by Text Removed - Justification 2 to Alexandroupolis hospital, having sevre bellyache.

records.location_details: Evros, Greece, same location as previous shooting incidents.
records.uncertainty_note: Specific location within Evros is redacted.
records.context_note: Two shooting incidents involving gunshots from Turkish patrol boats were reported in the Evros region of Greece. No Frontex TMs were involved or injured. The incidents were similar to previous cases in the area.
records.evidence_quote: two new shooting incidents in Text Removed - Justification 4, in the same location where shooting incident took place a few days ago: ... from a Turkish patrol boat

records.location_details: Evros, Greece.
records.uncertainty_note: Specific location within Evros is redacted.
records.context_note: A dead male migrant (30-35 years old, unknown nationality) was found in the Evros region of Greece. No travel documents were found. The autopsy excluded criminal activity as the cause of death.
records.evidence_quote: a dead body (male), aged between 30-35 has been found in Text Removed - Justification 4. ... the deceased was a migrant (nationality unknown) and the autopsy excluded any criminal activity

records.location_details: Evros river, near the Turkish bank, Evros, Greece.
records.where_clear: Evros river, border area, Greece (Turkish bank)
records.uncertainty_note: Specific location within Evros is redacted.
records.context_note: A shooting incident occurred at the Evros river border, where a Turkish Gendarmerie patrol fired a gunshot and a Turkish soldier aimed an assault rifle at Greek/Frontex patrols, making provocative gestures. Turkish patrol boats were also involved. No injuries were reported.
records.evidence_quote: HP Officer Text Removed - Justification 4 while patrolling with Text Removed - Justification 2 close to Evros river reported a shooting incident by Turkish Gendarmerie patrol that was patrolling in a close distance at the Turkish bank of the river.

records.location_details: Alexandroupolis, Greece (hospitalized), with prior travel to Thessaloniki.
records.context_note: A Frontex staff member in Alexandroupolis, Greece, tested positive for COVID-19 after experiencing symptoms. The individual had previously been on leave in Thessaloniki, an area with confirmed cases. The staff member was hospitalized in Alexandroupolis, and disinfection measures were taken.
records.evidence_quote: Text Removed - Justification 2 in Alexandroupolis reported about a new confirmed case of Covid-19 Text Removed - Justification 4. The infected person is Text Removed - Justification 2.

records.location_details: Military Hospital in Sofia, Bulgaria.
records.context_note: A Frontex staff member was hospitalized in Sofia, Bulgaria, with symptoms compatible with COVID-19 (breathing difficulties, chest/lung pain). A COVID-19 test returned negative. The staff member was discharged and advised to rest as a preventive measure.
records.evidence_quote: Text Removed - Justification 2 has been hospitalized at the Military Hospital in Sofia. ... Covid-19 test gave a NEGATIVE result.
